column65: They went by the high-road; but Owen was not satisfied, because he saw that his companions did not comply for his sake; and as he walked on, he began to kick up the dust with his feet, saying, "I'm sure it is much pleasanter here than in the lane; I wish we were to come back this way--I'm sure it is much pleasanter here than in the lane: is not it, Marianne?"
column66: "Let us help him, though he did trample on our cherries," said the good-natured Marianne,--"He is sorry for what he did, and he will never be so ill-humoured or ill-natured again--Come, let us go and help him--If we all help, we shall have his work finished in time, and then we shall all be happy together."
